channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large amount of yellow liquid, 12th November
item.description:
Looks like paint dumped in gully. Starting to spread and looks dangerous for wildlife

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped sofa along Churchill Walk, 12th November
item.description:
Sofa dumped along Churchill Walk, at the end of a block I think between Tresham Walk and Dean Close but I might be one block off. It is completely obvious. The sofa and all the cushions were dumped there weeks ago and have not been removed. Very unsightly
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dean Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken door and broken fence along brook path, 12th November
item.description:
There used to be a door to this path and it has been broken for a year or so. The fences have also broke. I’ve seen curious secondary school children wandering into that path and there is a risk of falling into the brook. For public safety, I think the door and fence should be fixed like the one on cromwell road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampden Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking, 12th November
item.description:
My driveway is constantly blocked by cars because there is no parking restrictions or anything. Is there anything that I can do or can be done. I have a 4 month old child where I’ve had to take to appointments via public transport because I am not able to exit my own driveway. Please help. I have left notes on these specific cars that have been doing it which has had no effect. We have spoke to the drivers also but no result please could you advise me on what the next step is.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrewsbury Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lighting on Havelock Road close to junction with Homesdale Eoad, 12th November
item.description:
Havelock Road is very dark, especially near junction with Homesdale. Now it’s dark early it makes it much worse. There are also undesirable people hanging around at that junction which feels intimidating. The street lights along the whole of Havelock Road need to be looked at please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havelock Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public alleyway needs cutting, 12th November
item.description:
The alleyway is of public use to the fields behind and needs cutting. It is full of stinging nettles and dogs and children are walking up and down here on a daily basis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmsdale Grove, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lewisham Road, Lewisham

item.title: Mattress next to Dover Court, 12th November
item.description:
Apart from the mattress, there’s a lot of rubbish all the way down the street to the junction with Lewisham Road. There’s also builders rubbish along with paint pots on the traffic island.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blackheath Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on olive tree planters, 12th November
item.description:
Graffiti on the 3 olive tree planters on the junction of Chadwick and Bellenden rd by the p13 bustop. Planters were made and funded by the greener , safer fund many years ago m
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Lyndhurst Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge A-board obstructing the footway, 12th November
item.description:
An enormous A-board advertising Boxhall is regularly obstructing the very busy eastern footway of Old Broad Street outside the entrance to The Arcade, by number 71. The City's current transport strategy rightly places great emphasis on keeping our footways free of obstructions, and a clear policy of no permission for A-boards is top of the list of actions listed in Outcome 3, Proposal 16, on page 62 of the City of London's transport strategy, second edition October 2024. Please advise the business owner that they do not have permission and enforce if necessary. The thousands of people who use this narrow footway daily will be grateful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Old Broad Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 12th November
item.description:
Lots of dumped material

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Lane, North Kensington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load (Estates)

item.title: Resident’s wall collapsing, 12th November
item.description:
On the corner of Edgebury and Belmont Lane, a resident’s wall has a large crack ( possibly caused by trees) and is leaning towards the footpath. Potential danger of collapse and especially serious as this is a road where many children walk past on the way to Edgebury Primary School. Owner needs to be made aware of this and eliminate danger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edgebury, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full council waste bin, 12th November
item.description:
The public bin located outside the Portman square Garden opposite to the Hyaat Hotel is full of litter. There are also two bags dumped near the bin. The bin needs to be emptied and waste needs to be completed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71-73, Upper Berkeley Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Countdown unit not working, 12th November
item.description:
As shown in the picture, the coundown display is working but it's failing to connect, instead showing the Stop ID and obfuscated IP addresses for itself and the CSI1 server to which it's presumably failing to connect. This has been happening frequently at this bus stop over several years. What is the underlying problem, I wonder?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsland Road, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Princess road, 12th November
item.description:
There are a number of street lights out along Princess Road which have been out for months and also reported a number of times by other residents. Please replace the bulbs for nighttime safety. Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Princess Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa being left outside the flat, 12th November
item.description:
This is a constant problem, neighbours throwing unwanted items in front of the flat. I have reported so many incidents, something needs to be done from preventing people as using this area as dump hole

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Yoakley Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Car blocking bus stop snd pavement, 12th November
item.description:
There are always cars parked on the pavement by the bus stop. They should be find and/ or removed. It is an ongoing problem. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Grange Road, Old Kent Road, London
